definitions.definition: existing only in your mind or imagination

examples.text: The equator is an imaginary line around the middle of the earth.
I had an imaginary friend when I was a child.
As children they invented the imaginary world of Gondal.
We must listen to their problems, real or imaginary.
Children experience a lot of imaginary fears at this age.

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from Latin imaginarius, from imago, imagin- ‘image’.
